com.hlag.oversigt.util

Class GrowingExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hlag.oversigt.util.GrowingExecutor

  • public class GrowingExecutor
extends Object
    An executor that uses a variable number of threads to execute the provided tasks. The number of threads grows slowly if required.
    Author:
    Olaf Neumann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GrowingExecutor()
      Create a new GrowingExecutor with default settings.
      The default settings are: Core pool size: 1 Unlimited number of additional threads Wait one second before adding new threads to the executor Wait 5 minutes before ending a thread
      GrowingExecutor(int corePoolSize, int maximumNumberOfThreads, Duration waitBeforeAddingThreads, Duration waitBeforeThreadShutdown, ThreadFactory threadFactory)
      Create a new GrowingExecutor with the given configuration

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Future<T> execute(Callable<T> callable)
      Execute the given task and return a Future to retrieve the calculated result.
      void join()
      Joins all running threads.
      static void main(String[] args)
      Test method
      void shutdown()
      Sets an internal flag that new tasks will not be accepted any more.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrowingExecutor

        public GrowingExecutor()
        Create a new GrowingExecutor with default settings.
        The default settings are:
        • Core pool size: 1
        • Unlimited number of additional threads
        • Wait one second before adding new threads to the executor
        • Wait 5 minutes before ending a thread

      • GrowingExecutor

        public GrowingExecutor(int corePoolSize,
                       int maximumNumberOfThreads,
                       Duration waitBeforeAddingThreads,
                       Duration waitBeforeThreadShutdown,
                       ThreadFactory threadFactory)
        Create a new GrowingExecutor with the given configuration
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the minimum number of threads to maintain if the executor has nothing to do
        maximumNumberOfThreads - the maximum number of threads to create if the executor is busy
        waitBeforeAddingThreads - time to wait before adding a new thread to the executor
        waitBeforeThreadShutdown - time to keep a thread alive if there's nothing to do
        threadFactory - the thread factory creating new threads for the executor

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public <T> Future<T> execute(Callable<T> callable)
        Execute the given task and return a Future to retrieve the calculated result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type return value
        Parameters:
        callable - the action to be executed
        Returns:
        a value to retrieve the calculated result
        Throws:
        org.jboss.weld.exceptions.IllegalStateException - if the Callable is submitted but shutdown() has been called before.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Sets an internal flag that new tasks will not be accepted any more. Only already queued tasks will be executed.

      • join

        public void join()
          throws InterruptedException
        Joins all running threads. This method blocks until all threads of this executor have ended.
        If the core pool size is greater than 0 this method will never return if shutdown() has not been called. On the other hand, this method will return if the core pool size is 0 but the executor is still accepting new tasks.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if a thread is interrupted while joining it

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Test method
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments
        Throws:
        Exception - if something fails
